FTD (frontotemporal degeneration)

* Often affects people under 60,
* There is sometimes a family history of FTD.
* Genetic and lesional heterogeneity (abnormal metabolism of tau protein).

The initial clinical presentation is often marked by :

* BEHAVIOURAL DISORDERS'' by behavioural executive impairment (disinhibition, apathy, impulsivity, eating disorders...)
* Dysexecutive syndrome
* Neurological examination initially normal, then appearance of archaic reflexes, pyramidal syndrome, astasia-abasia, etc.
* Bilateral anterior ''FRONTAL and TEMPORAL ATROPHIA'' on brain MRI

question.title: What is often the initial clinical presentation of frontotemporal lobar degeneration (FTD)?

option_a.title: Neurological examination initially abnormal, with bilateral anterior frontal and temporal atrophy on brain MRI

option_b.title: Dysexecutive syndrome, with behavioral executive impairment and disinhibition, apathy, impulsivity, eating disorders...

option_c.title: A family history of FTD, with genetic and lesional heterogeneity (abnormal metabolism of tau protein)

option_d.title: A neurological examination initially normal, with no abnormalities on brain MRI

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: This consists only a letter of the correct option
